data.title: Game stopped loading
data.body:
I had a battle with a friend. Then I closed the game, went out for a walk. Came back and wanted to play him again. Game stopped loading. Restarted computer again and again. Still the same. Reinstalled the game twice. Same problem.

Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.42000
Exception of type `System.IO.FileNotFoundException`: The system cannot find the file specified. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x80070002)
   at System.Reflection.RuntimeAssembly.nLoadFile(String path, Evidence evidence)
   at System.Reflection.Assembly.LoadFile(String path)
   at OpenRA.Sound..ctor(String engineName)
   at OpenRA.Game.Initialize(Arguments args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)

I am running windows 10 home.

Please help me, I love this game. Thankyou very much.

data.title: Fix Lua API returning wrong player info
data.body:
The Lua API would return wrong information on player fields such as the team or faction when it was changed in the lobby. It referenced fields on the PlayerReference, which are pretty much read-only and don't get changed by the lobby.

![screenshot from 2016-08-11 20 21 51](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4331210/17600038/1a007a94-6002-11e6-935a-1f92bbeb647b.png)

Fixes #11808.

data.title: Player field "Team" returns 0 no matter what team the player is on.
data.body: If you try to get the team a player is on using Lua you will have 0 returned no matter what team the player is actually on.

data.title: Clearup mod AIs.
data.body:
The percentages might sound lame but having the summary of the riflemen and rocket infantry above 100 will make sure no techlevel gets stuck - excluding the RA Naval AI, which doesn't even use infantry at all (notsure if it should be allowed to spam those two).

Fixes #11797.

data.title: Airfield, Helipad and Service depo load balance
data.body: We already load balance Harvesters on Refineries we should try to generalize that code and use it for rearming and the service depo repair.

data.title: [SOLVED] System.InvalidTimeZoneException: TZ file too big for the buffer
data.body:
Game loads fine but clicking on anything results in a crash this includes clicking on 'Quit.'

Google searched and searched this repository and FAQ, but nothing around this issue.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20816697/17589596/436604c4-5f9b-11e6-8c21-1eb7c6608cab.png)

Machine is an Arch Linux running within a VM.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20816697/17589624/7232a2c6-5f9b-11e6-87bf-daa6fc0fb7a7.png)

data.title: Document Weapons/Warheads
data.body:
There is a big lack of documentation surrounding the yaml part of these 2 objects.
We really should rectify that.

data.title: ShadowFrames support
data.body:
Animation sequence system doesn't have support for defining shadow frames for animations which use Frames parameter to define complex animation.

Example: I've made the following code:

attack:
        Length: 16
        Facings: 8
        Frames: 56, 56, 56, 56, 57, 57, 58, 56,  57, 57, 58, 56,  57, 57, 58, 56,      59, 59, 59, 59, 60, 60, 61, 59,  60, 60, 61, 59,  60, 60, 61, 59,     62, 62, 62, 62, 63, 63, 64, 62,  63, 63, 64, 62,  63, 63, 64, 62,       65, 65, 65, 65, 66, 66, 67, 65,  66, 66, 67, 65,  66, 66, 67, 65,         68, 68, 68, 68, 69, 69, 70, 68,  69, 69, 70, 68,  69, 69, 70, 68,          71, 71, 71, 71, 72, 72, 73, 71,  72, 72, 73, 71,  72, 72, 73, 71,    74, 74, 74, 74, 75, 75, 76, 74,  75, 75, 76, 74,  75, 75, 76, 74,    77, 77, 77, 77, 78, 78, 79, 77,  78, 78, 79, 77,  78, 78, 79, 77
        Tick: 142

This is complex attack animation for unit with 8 facings. Unfortunately, I can't assign shadow frames to it because ShadowStart parameter is unused when using Frames parameter (GetSprite function)
(and looks like OpenRA mini-YAML parser also doesn't have support for multi-line definitions, so I had to use spaces)

data.title: Fix UpgradeOnDamage trait description
data.body: The old desc is bogus copy-pasta.

data.title: Allow multiple minelayers in a single MinefieldOrderGenerator.
data.body: This fixes #11763 by allowing multiple minelayers to be a part of the same minefield order.

data.title: Delete the Huntable trait for walls and gates.
data.body: This closes #11760 by making the walls non huntable, we might want to make some other things non huntable, like trees.

data.title: Destorying ore silos necessary for eliminating player
data.body: A player is not considered out of the game if they still have ore silos on the map.

data.title: Chinook units will land on top of each other
data.body: A group of Chinooks given a move order over land will attempt to land on top of each other (and will succeed unless blocked like in bug #11796 ).

data.title: AI gets bored and stops spending money

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
I have found that in most games the AI will eventually just stop spending money. I started an Infantry Only tech level skirmish to test a few things. The computer worked for a while and eventually stopped. There's 2 barracks, 4 ore refineries, lots of silos, and 12 infantry (two of them just outside the screencap area. 

![infantry](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20367532/17557623/e85c4756-5ee5-11e6-9c51-844417a73b5c.png)

This is a pitiful force which could be easily overcome with some infantry. The computer never explores, attacks, or continues building.

data.title: Multiple helicopters fail queued movement if exact waypoint not available
data.body:
If you give a group of helicopters queued move orders, they will not move to the second waypoint until they can reach the first waypoint precisely. If the first waypoint is blocked (by another helicopter trying to access the waypoint), the other helicopters will hover as close as possible rather than being "close enough" and moving to the next waypoint.

build 5 helicopters
give them a waypoint and queue a second waypoint
Hind units will bunch close together and none of them will reach the waypoint. Chinook and Longbow units will typically have the first 1 or 2 units reach the first waypoint and move on to the second. The others will circle around the first waypoint.
If you manually move one of the stuck helicopters out of the way, that will usually clear up the first waypoint and the other helicopters will reach the first waypoint and move to the second.

data.title: Units & Pillboxes
data.body:
So if you put a mechanic inside a pillbox they can't repair vehicles 
If you put a rocket soldier inside can't attack air

data.body:

I'm woried about [this line](https://github.com/Turupawn/OpenRA/commit/d090ec758c9498143821b22edc6451526bb2a814#diff-d7a57eebc0a2b3d470e099590d38922eL97). I replaced it to make it work. Does it breakes another feature?

data.title: Updated and included the SDL2 and OpenAL bindings
data.body: We will never see releases for them, because they are meant to be included in commercial game ports. This gives us the benefit to adapt them to our needs (or rather strip what we don't need like #10288) and it is 2 fewer non-reusable dependencies for @rapgro and others to package which brings us closer to #8264.

data.title: Fix voxel rendering with EnableDepthBuffer: True
data.body:
This gets us another step closer towards being able to enable the depth buffer rendering in the gen2 mods (nearly there!) by rendering voxels with an approximately correct z coordinate so that they are composited at (nearly) the right place in the world.

The "approximately" and "(nearly)" are because we throw away the per-pixel depth information associated with the model and for now can only render a flat billboard.  As commented in the code, this is because we have at most four colour channels to store 5 sets of data (RGB, alpha, and depth).  For now hacking the depth gives a good-enough result that we can improve further down the line when the voxel renderer is rewritten.

You'll notice when testing that the voxels clip beneath the ground when moving over slopes.  This isn't the renderer's fault: the heightmap-unaware movement code really is making the actors move partially underground, in addition to not being able to rotate them to match the slope.

data.title: Include milliseconds in TakeScreenshot timestamp.
data.body: Resolves the complain at http://www.ppmforums.com/viewtopic.php?t=42443.

data.title: Allow saving maps with multiple visibility options

milestone.title: release-20161015

data.body: Fixes #11692.

data.title: Make turning-while-moving actors follow curved paths.

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
The code for moving units through cells independently lerps actor positions along disjoint straight-lines between cell edges while smoothly varying the facing.  This leads to subtly wrong-looking moves when units turn corners (actors move in a different direction to their facing).

The effect is small, but extremely irritating when you know what to look for... or even when you don't: this is the main cause of the often-repeated "OpenRA's turning is too smooth" complaint.

This PR replaces the linear position lerping with arcs.  It still ignores the unit's ROT because incorporating that would (a) be much more complicated and (b) break balance (fast units wouldn't be able to turn sharply enough to move without stopping).

Before and after videos:
- [before](https://www.dropbox.com/s/qp5u64egxgsdb5h/before.mov?dl=0)
- [after](https://www.dropbox.com/s/ziio8vbzldgwnn2/after.mov?dl=0)

Fixes #11212.

data.title: Same unit command sounds wont overlap anymore
data.body:
When the player submits an order to a unit, it will now stop the previous sound before playing the new one.
This will prevent ventriloquists units.

I made a [short video](https://youtu.be/4uljtQ3zRjU) that shows the results.

Sorry for the graphics lag, I haven't got a proper screen recording setup right now.
